intro: Hieracium dolichophyllum, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
